events.message: The insured reported an auto accident involving a collision with another vehicle at the intersection during rainy conditions.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under the Auto Accident cluster as it clearly involves vehicle collision damages.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to begin communications with the claimant and collect additional accident details.
The claimant received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged and is being processed.
Request sent to the claimant for accident photos, police report, and proof of vehicle registration to support the claim.
Claimant submitted all requested documents including accident photos and official police report for claim verification.
The investigation team initiated a review of the submitted evidence to verify the circumstances and extent of the vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded confirming the accident details and that the claimant is not at fault for the collision.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover vehicle repair costs and any related damages from the auto accident.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and timely communication during the claim process.
The insurance claim was officially approved following the claimant's acceptance of the proposed settlement amount.
Payment for the agreed settlement was issued to the claimantâ€™s registered bank account without delay.
The auto accident claim was closed successfully after disbursing payment and resolving all outstanding issues.
The case file for the auto accident claim was archived in the system for record-keeping and future reference.
